top_comment.text:
While this video is utterly brilliant and well-made (as usual with Tom's 
material) I really hate the lack of detail when it comes to the 
sniper-rifle Pug is using.

The SFX was wrong for a Barrett-rifle and one can't fire a .50 cal rifle 
that rapidly. Not even if you are the most awesome Cpt Puglsy.

Why do I even bring up a nit-pick like this? Because Tom is a genius and I 
expect (almost) perfection from him. And it is because I like his videos so 
much that I dare criticize them.

EDIT: Above I wrote that "I really hate the lack of detail..." which is 
something I can't understand. I must have been tired ur just in a bad mood. 
I am so sorry for that.

What I really meant is that I would love to see such a minor detail as 
sniper physics and SFX to be as authentic as possible. At least the SFX, as 
Barrett .50 cals have quite a distinguishable sound; I am no expert by any 
means, but you easily understand if you look up a few videos here on 
youtube. Assault rifels and submachine guns are easier to fake, albeit some 
gun-nuts are sure to note the errors there. =)

So in the end, I think this video is bloody brilliant in terms of story and 
execution. It was just that I, as I said, thought it was interesting that 
everything else was so well thought-out except for that minor detail.﻿
